incorporation_agency: Puerto Rico Department of State - Corporations Division
charitable_registration_agency: Puerto Rico Department of Justice - Consumer Affairs
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross revenue under $25,000 annually may be exempt. Religious organizations exempt.

formation_requirements.certificate_of_formation: Articles of Incorporation - Nonprofit Corporation (Corporación sin Fines de Lucro)
formation_requirements.notes: Puerto Rico follows civil law tradition with influences from Spanish law. Bilingual filings accepted.

requirements.notes: Annual report fee $150. Due April 15th for all nonprofits.

requirements.requirement_name: Puerto Rico Sales and Use Tax Exemption
requirements.notes: Qualifying nonprofits may be exempt from 11.5% combined sales tax (IVU).
Annual application by July 1st to Municipal Revenue Collection Center.

requirements.filing_agency: Puerto Rico Tourism Company - Gaming Board
requirements.notes: Required for charitable gaming including raffles and bingo.
Audit required for organizations with revenue over $300,000.

special_notes.civil_law_system: Puerto Rico follows civil law tradition with influences from Spanish law, distinct from common law states.
special_notes.bilingual: Documents may be filed in Spanish or English. Spanish name: 'Corporación sin Fines de Lucro'.
special_notes.ivu_tax: Puerto Rico has 11.5% combined sales and use tax (IVU - Impuesto sobre Ventas y Uso).
special_notes.april_15_deadline: All nonprofits must file annual reports by April 15th.
special_notes.audit_threshold: $300,000 revenue threshold for mandatory audit is higher than many states.
special_notes.municipal_system: Property taxes administered by Municipal Revenue Collection Center (CRIM), not individual municipalities.
